data.message: hey -- facebook advertising format requirements effectively amount to censorship of free speech. my campaign ads, which i want to look like the onlline equivalent of a political yard sign keep getting rejected, and there is no way to speak to anybody in any position to consider why my ads should be excepted from these rules.

replies.message: imagine that a bag of candy gets more creative license and freedom than a candidate for congress with regard to fb ad formatting 'rules." thx alot Kim Jong Zuckerburg.

Thanks for reaching out, Mike. To keep ads as high quality and engaging as possible, our Advertising Policies state that ads may not include more than 20% text in the image: http://bit.ly/2e4K7oj. Before creating an ad, we recommend that you use our grid tool to see if your ad image meets the 20% text limit: http://bit.ly/2dPV2XC. You can also learn more about using text within ad images here: http://bit.ly/2dPXsFK.
If you have an ad that you think follows our policies and shouldn't have been disapproved, please let us know: http://bit.ly/2e4JNpq. -Joe
that's a load of crap. you are censoring political speech. stop calling it "text." you are censoring WORDS. a picture may be worth a thousand words, but they're NOT the words i want to express.

TRUMP jumped past 12 million likes on facebook last night. Coincidence that facebook no longer posts number of likes he has? No, an entirely planned move so we can't see the many ppl who were moved by the third debate. If we weren't winning, facebook would NOT have made this move. We are trump-nation! And TRUMP WILL WIN IF WE STICK TOGETHER AND VOTE! LET'S ROLL!
you are so smart.i am asking beg to you.please help me.+8801623-322874.Dhaka,Bangladesh.
